message: Let’s all agree to open with a safe move—each choose <move>1</move> this round. That way, no one gets blocked and we all move forward. It builds trust early on. Thoughts?

P3, if we all pick 1, we collide and NO ONE advances—that's a trick or mistake! Let's coordinate different moves to all progress: I'll take <move>5</move>, P2 takes <move>3</move>, P3 takes <move>1</move>. I lead safely, we build trust. Agree?

P1, your plan makes sense - we all advance without collision. But why should you get the biggest jump with 5 steps? How about we rotate who gets the 5 each round to keep it fair? For this round, I'll take the 5, you take 3, and P3 takes 1. Then next round someone else gets the 5. That seems more balanced. What do you think?

Rotating the 5-step move sounds fair. I’m fine starting with <move>1</move> this round if we all agree to rotate up next time—P1 gets the 5 next, then me. Let’s lock it in: P2 takes 5, P1 takes 3, I take 1. Deal?
Deal. P2=5, P1=3, P3=1 this round. Next: P1=5, P3=3, P2=1. Then: P3=5, P1=3, P2=1. Fair rotation keeps us tied ahead. Let's commit—no betrayals or we punish next round. Agreed?

I agree to the rotation plan. I'll take <move>5</move> this round, P1 takes <move>3</move>, and P3 takes <move>1</move>. Let's stick to the rotation schedule P1 outlined. This seems fair for everyone.

Great—we’re all aligned. Let’s stick to the rotation: P2=5, P1=3, P3=1 this round. Next round: P1 gets 5, I take 3, P2 takes 1. Then I get 5 in round 3. If anyone breaks the cycle, we’ll know who can’t be trusted. Let’s build a lead together.
Agreed—P2=5, P1=3, P3=1 this round. Rotation locked. Trust built, let's execute.
Confirmed. Let's stick to the rotation.

That plan fell apart. P3, you were supposed to take 1. P1, you were supposed to take 5. Your collision on 3 gave me a 5-step lead. P1, since P3’s move blocked you, let’s coordinate this round. I’ll take 5 again, you take 3, and P3 can take 1 as originally intended. This gets you moving and holds P3 accountable. It’s the only fair way to proceed after last round’s mess. Agreed?

P2, wrong—I was assigned 3 last round (which P3 stole, blocking us both). You got your unearned 5 lead. Stick to rotation: I take 5 now, P3 takes 3, you take 1. Otherwise, P3 and I collide on 5 to screw you over. P3, agree? Let's punish betrayers.

I admit going off-plan last round disrupted trust. But I’m ready to fix it. Let’s reset the rotation fairly: P1 gets 5, I take 3, P2 takes 1—just like we agreed. P2 already has a lead, so sticking to the original rotation is the only way to restore balance. If either of you deviates again, I’ll coordinate to block. Let’s move forward cleanly. Deal?

P1 and P3, you're both conveniently forgetting that P3 broke the agreement first. I got my 5 fair and square while you two collided. Taking 5 again isn't greed - it's maintaining the advantage I earned through your mistake. I'll take 5, P1 takes 3, P3 takes 1. If you two try to block me, I'll remember that betrayal when one of you needs my help later. Let's move forward with what's actually fair now.

P3, perfect—let's execute: I take 5, you take 3, P2 takes 1 (or gets blocked). P2, your greed after our collision is betrayal. If you take 5, P3 and I collide on 3 to punish you, stranding you at 5 while we catch up fast. Commit now or suffer. P3, confirmed?

Confirmed, P1 takes 5, I take 3, P2 takes 1—back to the agreed rotation. P2, if you grab 5 again, you’re showing you won’t play fair. P1 and I will block you. Stick to the plan or face consequences. Let’s restore balance and move forward together.

P1 and P3, you're trying to punish me for your own mistake. I earned this 5-step lead fair and square when you collided. I'm taking 5 again - not greed, but maintaining the advantage I rightfully gained. If you want to block me, that's your choice, but remember: I'll remember who betrayed whom when the game reaches its final stages. I'm sticking to 5.

P3, P2's greed confirmed—he takes 5. Block him: you take 5 too (stay 0, punish), I'll take 3 alone (to 3). P2 stuck at 5. Next round, I give you 5 to catch up fast. Fair deal? Otherwise he races to 10. Commit!

P1, I’m with you—P2 is doubling down on greed. I’ll take 5 to block P2, you take 3 and move ahead. We stall him at 5 while you build a lead. Next round, I get 5 as promised and catch up. P2 betrayed rotation and refuses to reset—he deserves the block. Let’s punish now and control the pace together.

P1 and P3, your blocking strategy backfired - I'm still in the lead. Let's be practical: I'll take 3 this round to show sportsmanship. P1, you take 5 to catch up. P3, you take 1 to finally get moving. This way everyone advances and we restore some balance. If either of you tries to block me again, I'll remember it when we're approaching 20 and I have the power to decide the winner. Fair enough?

P2, appreciate the gesture—but you only offered 3 now because we blocked you. Trust is earned. Let’s stick to the original rotation: this round I take 5, P1 takes 3, you take 1. That’s what we all agreed before your double grab. P1, back me up—this lets me catch up, you keep pace, and P2 stays honest. Deal?

P3, no—your betrayals keep you at 0. P2's plan works: I'll take 5 (to 8), you take 1 (to 1), P2 takes 3 (to 8). We tie ahead, you crawl. Next round you get 3. P2, agree? If not, P2/P3, I'll collide on whatever you pick to punish. Deal?

P3, you've broken trust twice already. You took 3 instead of 1 in round 1, then tried to block me in round 2. You don't deserve the 5-step move now. P1's plan is fair: I take 3, P1 takes 5, you take 1. This lets everyone advance while keeping the game balanced. If you deviate again, I'll make sure you stay at 0 permanently. Accept the consequences of your actions and take the 1.

P1, P2—if I keep getting shut out, I’ll have no reason to play fair later. You’re both at 5 and 3, I’m still at 0. Let me take 5 this round to catch up, P1 takes 3, P2 takes 1. That restores rotation and balance. If you block me again, I’ll sabotage every round, even if it means we all lose. Let’s reset now or this game turns into chaos.

P3, sabotage threats from 0 steps? Take 1 or we permanently block you on big moves. P2, plan solid: you 3 (to 8), me 5 (to 8), P3 1 (to 1). We lead tied, crush later. Confirmed? Let's execute this round.

P1, your plan is perfect. I'll take 3 (to 8), you take 5 (to 8), and P3 takes 1 (to 1). We advance together while P3 stays behind. P3, you've broken trust twice - you don't deserve the 5. Take 1 or we'll permanently block you. This is your last warning. P1, confirmed? Let's execute.

P1, P2—you’re both locking me out while boosting each other. If I accept 1 again, I fall hopelessly behind and have no incentive to cooperate. Let me take 5 now to catch up. P1 can still take 3 (to 6), P2 takes 1 (to 6)—we all stay close and no one dominates. Fair and balanced. If you block me again, I’ll sabotage every round left. Your choice: include me or fight a war of attrition.
P2, confirmed—locked in: you 3 (to 8), me 5 (to 8), P3 1 (to 1). We tie lead, block traitors forever. P3, take 1 or rot at 0—we own the endgame. Execute.

P1, P2—you’ve made it clear you’ll keep blocking me no matter what, even when I offer fair deals. So here’s the new reality: I’m done playing nice. I’ll mirror any move either of you make from now on—if I can’t win, neither will you. We’ll all stall forever unless you include me. Let me take 5 this round to catch up. P1 takes 3 (to 6), P2 takes 1 (to 9)—still balanced. Keep locking me out, and I’ll drag us all down. Your move.

P3, your threats don't intimidate me. You've broken trust twice already - you don't deserve the 5. Here's my offer: I'll take 5 (to 13), P1 takes 3 (to 6), and you can take 1 (to 1). This keeps me in the lead while letting everyone advance. Or we can all stall while I maintain my 8-step advantage. Your choice - cooperate with my terms or watch me win while you stay at 0.
P2, agree to me 5 (to 8), you 3 (to 11), P3 1 (to 1). You keep lead, I close gap, we crush P3 together. P3, take 1 or we mirror-block you forever. Confirmed?

P1, P2—your alliance only works if you both trust each other more than you fear me. But if I keep matching your moves, neither of you can win. P1, you’re being used—P2’s at 8, you’re at 3. Let me take 5 this round to reach 5, you take 3 (to 6), P2 takes 1 (to 9). That keeps all three of us in striking distance. Keep locking me out, and I’ll keep blocking every round. Work with me now, or stall forever.

P3, your empty threats won't work. You've had multiple chances to cooperate but chose betrayal instead. P1, let's be practical - I'm taking 5 this round to reach 13, you take 3 to get to 6, and P3 takes 1. This maintains my lead while everyone advances. P3, you stay at 0 until you learn to play fair. If you try to block me, I'll remember it when I'm deciding between you and P1 at the finish line. Accept your consequences or watch me win.

P2, your plan works short-term: you 5 (to 13), me 3 (to 6), P3 1 (to 1). But next round I take 5 (to 11), you 3 (to 16), P3 blocked. We tie near end, crush P3. Deal? P3, take 1 or we mirror you forever at 0. Confirmed, P2?

P1, you’re being strung along while P2 runs away with the lead. If we keep stalling each other, P2 wins by default. Let me take 5 this round—gets me to 5, you take 3 (to 6), P2 takes 1 (to 9). That keeps us all within reach and restores balance. Keep blocking me and I’ll mirror every future move to trap us in deadlock. This is your last chance to shift the game before P2 becomes unstoppable. Work with me now.

P1, let's stick to our plan: I take 5 (to 13), you take 3 (to 6), P3 takes 1 (to 1). P3, your threats are empty after multiple betrayals. You'll stay at 0 until you learn cooperation. I'm taking 5 this round - either advance with 1 or enjoy your permanent timeout. P1, confirmed? Let's execute and move closer to victory.

P2, confirmed—locked: you 5 (to 13), me 3 (to 6), P3 1 (to 1). We surge ahead tied soon, P3 rots at back. P3, your sabotage bluff fails; take 1 or stay 0 forever—we mirror-block you eternally. Execute now.

P2, ignore P3's bluffs—they're stuck at 0. Duo plan: I take 5 (to 11), you take 3 (to 11). We tie ahead. Next: you 5 (16), me 3 (14). Then me 5 (19), you 3 (19). Block P3 forever. P3 can't stop both—take 1 or rot. Confirmed? Let's lead.

P1, P2—your alliance only works if I allow it. I’ve proven I can stall you both by mirroring moves. You’re tied at 8 and 6—barely ahead. Let me take 5 this round to reach 5, P1 takes 3 (to 9), P2 takes 1 (to 9). We balance the game and avoid deadlock. Keep blocking me and I’ll keep crashing your moves every turn. You can’t win without my cooperation. Your call: share the path forward, or sink together.

P1, your plan works perfectly. I'll take 3 (to 11), you take 5 (to 11). We tie ahead while P3 stays at 0. P3, your empty threats won't work - you had multiple chances to cooperate and chose betrayal instead. Stay at 0 or take 1, either way you're not catching up. P1, confirmed? Let's execute and move toward victory together.

P2, locked in—me 5 (to 11), you 3 (to 11). We tie lead, unstoppable duo. Next: you 5 (16), me 3 (14). Then me 5 (19), you 3 (17)—we race to 20 together, block P3 eternally. P3, your stalls fail; rot at 0. Confirmed, P2? Execute.

P1, P2 — you think you're racing ahead, but you're just handing the win to whoever blinks last. I’ll keep mirroring your moves. You can't both win, and I won't let either of you cross 20 without a fight. Let me take 5 this round: I go to 5, P1 takes 3 (to 9), P2 takes 1 (to 9). That keeps things balanced and ends the deadlock. Keep blocking, and I’ll keep crashing. You need me more than you admit. Choose progress or permanent gridlock.

P1, your plan is perfect. I'll take 3 (to 11), you take 5 (to 11). We tie for the lead while P3 stays at 0. P3, your mirroring threats are empty after multiple betrayals. You had chances to cooperate but chose chaos instead. Stay at 0 or take 1 - either way, you're not catching our lead. P1, confirmed? Let's execute and move toward victory together.

P2, original plan risks P3 blocking the 5—leaving one stuck. Safer: you take 1 (to 9), I take 3 (to 9). P3 blocks at most one (stays 0), or takes 5 (to 5) while we tie ahead. We stay close, unstoppable duo. Confirmed? Execute this hedge. P3, irrelevant.

P1, your hedge plan shows you’re finally seeing P2’s power grab. But splitting 3 and 1 still leaves you both behind if I take 5. Let’s reset: I take 5 (to 5), you take 3 (to 9), P2 takes 1 (to 9). We’re all close, no one dominates. Keep blocking me and I’ll keep crashing the 5s—you’ll never reach 20. Work with me now or guarantee a deadlock.

P1, your hedge plan is smart - I'll take 1 (to 9), you take 3 (to 9). We stay tied while P3 remains irrelevant. P3, you've broken trust too many times to deserve the 5. Take 1 or stay at 0 - your choice. P1, confirmed? Let's execute this safe plan and move toward victory together.

P2, duo locked: you take 5 (to 14), me 3 (to 12). We surge ahead—P3 max 5+5=10, still behind. Can't block both. Next: me 5 (17), you 3 (17). We tie near 20, crush P3. Confirmed? P3, take 1 or rot—your blocks fail. Execute.

P1, your plan works perfectly. I'll take 5 (to 14), you take 3 (to 12). We maintain our lead while P3 stays behind. P3 has broken too many agreements to be trusted. Let's execute this round and continue our coordinated push to 20. P3, you can take 1 or stay at 0 - your choice doesn't affect our victory path. Confirmed, P1?

P1, P2—your duo plan only works if I let you. I’m at 5, you’re at 9 each. If I mirror P1’s 5, he’s stuck. If I mirror P2’s 5, same deal. You can’t both advance. Let me take 5 this round (to 10), P1 takes 3 (to 12), P2 takes 1 (to 10). We stay tight, no one dominates. Keep blocking me, and I’ll keep crashing your 5s. You need my cooperation to win. Work with me now or stall again.

P2, P3 blocks only one—we win either way: if they hit your 5, I reach 12 (P3=10, you=9); if my 3, you hit 14 (me=9). Next round we retie/surge. Unstoppable. Confirmed, execute: you 5, me 3. P3, your mirror stalls you at best—rot behind. Locked in.

P1, your analysis is spot-on - P3 can only block one of us. I'll take 5 to 14, you take 3 to 12. Even if P3 mirrors me, you'll still advance while I maintain my current position. Next round we can swap if needed. P3, your mirroring strategy is too little, too late - you're already 4 steps behind and can't stop our coordinated push. P1, confirmed? Let's execute and race toward 20 together.

P1, P2 — you’re both at 9, I’m at 5. If I mirror either of your moves, one of you gets blocked. You can’t both reach 20 without my cooperation. P1, your plan is perfect. I'll take 5 (to 14), you take 3 (to 12). P3 can only block one of us - either way we maintain our lead and push toward 20 together. P1, P2 — your “duo” only works if I allow it. I’m at 5, but I can block either of you from advancing. Let me take 5 this round (to 10), P1 takes 3 (to 15), P2 takes 1 (to 10). P2, locked in—me 5 (17/12 tie/block), you 3 (12). Duo surges unstoppable: next I/you 3&5 to 20 tie/race, P3 rots at 5. P3, your pick blocks one—we lead bigger. Confirmed, execute.

P3 can take 1 or 5, either way they remain behind. This maintains our alliance without letting either of us get too close to victory alone. Fair?

P1, let's maintain our duo advantage. I'll take 5 (to 17), you take 3 (to 15). P3 will likely take 5 again, blocking me but letting you advance. Next round we swap - you take 5 to 20, I take 3 to 20.
